member.name: N:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferErrorMessagesTask
member.summary: The allows the transfer error messages from one instance of SQL Server to another.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferErrorMessagesTask.IfObjectExists
member.summary: Contains values used by the property of the to determine how to handle a transfer when the error message exists at the destination.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferErrorMessagesTask.IfObjectExists.FailTask
member.summary: Causes the task to fail if the same error message exists at the destination.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferErrorMessagesTask.IfObjectExists.Overwrite
member.summary: Overwrites the error message if the same error message exists at the destination.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferErrorMessagesTask.IfObjectExists.Skip
member.summary: Skips the transfer of an error message if the same error message exists at the destination.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferErrorMessagesTask.TransferErrorMessagesTask
member.summary: Provides the ability to copy one or more SQL Server user-defined error messages to another instance of SQL Server. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferErrorMessagesTask.TransferErrorMessagesTask.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferErrorMessagesTask.TransferErrorMessagesTask.AcceptBreakpointManager(Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.BreakpointManager)
member.summary: Allows the task to create, remove, and check the status of breakpoints. This method is called by the run-time engine when a task or container is created and is not used in code.
member.param: The to use for controlling breakpoints on this task or container.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferErrorMessagesTask.TransferErrorMessagesTask.Execute(Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.Connections,Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.VariableDispenser,Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.IDTSComponentEvents,Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.IDTSLogging,System.Object)
member.summary: Runs the task as part of a package workflow.
member.returns: A enumeration that indicates the outcome of the execution.
member.param: The transaction object that the container is a part of, depending on the value found in the property. This value can be null.

member.summary: Initializes the properties associated with the task. This method is called by the runtime and is not used in code.
member.param: A collection of connections used by the task.
An object that implements the interface.
A collection that contains events to be raised during execution of the task.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferErrorMessagesTask.TransferErrorMessagesTask.LoadFromXML(System.Xml.XmlElement,Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.IDTSInfoEvents)
member.summary: This method is not callable by your application code. To load a package saved as .xml, use the method.
member.param: The XmlElement that contains the information to be loaded.
An object that implements the interface for firing events (errors, warnings, and so on) during persistence.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferErrorMessagesTask.TransferErrorMessagesTask.ResumeExecution
member.summary: Resumes execution of the task after pausing. The task is resumed by the run-time engine.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferErrorMessagesTask.TransferErrorMessagesTask.SaveToXML(System.Xml.XmlDocument,Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.IDTSInfoEvents)
member.summary: This method is not callable by your application code. To save a package as .xml, use the method.
member.param: The XML document to which to save the information.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferErrorMessagesTask.TransferErrorMessagesTask.SuspendExecution
member.summary: Called by the run-time engine when the executable needs to suspend.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferErrorMessagesTask.TransferErrorMessagesTask.Validate(Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.Connections,Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.VariableDispenser,Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.IDTSComponentEvents,Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.IDTSLogging)
member.summary: Allows the container to determine if it contains invalid settings that will prevent it from executing successfully.
member.returns: A enumeration that indicates the outcome of the validation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferErrorMessagesTask.TransferErrorMessagesTask.DebugMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean indicating whether a task should determine whether breakpoints are enabled.
member.returns: true if the task should determine whether breakpoints are enabled; false if the task can ignore all breakpoints.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferErrorMessagesTask.TransferErrorMessagesTask.DestinationConnection
member.summary: Gets or sets a String containing the name of the SMO connection manager for the destination database.
member.returns: A String that contains the SMO connection manager.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferErrorMessagesTask.TransferErrorMessagesTask.ErrorMessageLanguagesList
member.summary: Gets or sets a StringCollection containing the user-defined error messages to transfer.
member.returns: A StringCollection that lists the user-defined error messages to transfer.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferErrorMessagesTask.TransferErrorMessagesTask.ErrorMessagesList
member.summary: Gets or sets a StringCollection containing the IDs of the languages to transfer.
member.returns: A StringCollection that lists the language IDs of error messages to transfer.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferErrorMessagesTask.TransferErrorMessagesTask.ExecutionValue
member.summary: Returns an object containing the number of error messages that were transferred.
member.returns: An object that contains the number of error messages that were transferred.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferErrorMessagesTask.TransferErrorMessagesTask.IfObjectExists
member.summary: Gets or sets a value from the enumeration indicating indicating if the task should fail, overwrite, or skip the transfer of the errror message if an error message with the same name exists at the destination.
member.returns: A value from the enumeration indicating whether the task should fail, ignore the existing error message, or skip the transfer of the error message, if an error message of the same name exists at the destination.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferErrorMessagesTask.TransferErrorMessagesTask.SourceConnection
member.summary: Gets or sets a String containing the name of the SMO connection manager for the source database.
member.returns: A String that contains the SMO connection for the source database.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferErrorMessagesTask.TransferErrorMessagesTask.SuspendRequired
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean indicating whether a task should suspend if it encounters a breakpoint. This value is set by the run-time engine for the tasks and containers when a breakpoint is encountered.
member.returns: true if the task suspends when it encounters a breakpoint; false if the breakpoint can be ignored.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferErrorMessagesTask.TransferErrorMessagesTask.TransferAllErrorMessages
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean indicating whether all user-defined error messages at the source should be transferred, or only the specified error messages.
member.returns: true if all user-defined error messages are transferred.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.TransferErrorMessagesTask.TransferErrorMessagesTask.DtsTransferErrorMessagesException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown at load time if the persisted name of the XML root node of the task is corrupt.
